RTC - Real-Time Clock
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides comprehensive functions for interfacing with the Real-Time Clock (RTC) peripheral on Apollo5 devices. It supports time keeping, alarm functionality, date/time validation, and interrupt handling for precise real-time clock operations and scheduling.

Key Features

  1. Time Keeping: Accurate real-time clock functionality.
  2. Alarm Support: Configurable alarm and interval functionality.
  3. Date/Time Validation: Comprehensive date and time validation.
  4. Interrupt Handling: Interrupt support for time and alarm events.
  5. Oscillator Control: Flexible oscillator selection and control.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure RTC peripheral
  • Set and get current time and date
  • Configure alarm functionality and intervals
  • Handle RTC interrupts and status monitoring
  • Support oscillator selection and control

Usage

  1. Configure RTC using am_hal_rtc_config()
  2. Set current time with am_hal_rtc_time_set()
  3. Configure alarms and intervals as needed
  4. Handle RTC interrupts and time events
  5. Monitor RTC status and time updates

Configuration

  • Time Format: Configure time format and validation
  • Alarm Settings: Set up alarm intervals and repeat modes
  • Oscillator: Select RTC oscillator source
  • Interrupts: Configure interrupt sources and handlers

Oscillator Selector.

Options for the RTC oscillator.

Used with am_hal_rtc_config

enum  am_hal_rtc_osc_select_e {
  AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_XT = 0x0 ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_LFRC = 0x1
}
 

RTC Alarm Repeat Interval.

Macro definitions for the RTC alarm repeat interval.

These macros correspond to the RPT bits in the RTCCTL register. They may be used with the am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set() function.

Note: AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH and AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_100TH do not correspond to the RPT bits but are used in conjunction with setting the ALM100 bits in the ALMLOW register.

enum  am_hal_rtc_alarm_repeat_e {
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DIS = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_DIS ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_YR = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_YEAR ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MTH = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_MONTH ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_WK = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_WEEK ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_DAY = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_DAY ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_HR = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_HR ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_MIN = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_MIN ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_SEC = RTC_RTCCTL_RPT_SEC ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_10TH ,
  AM_HAL_RTC_ALM_RPT_100TH
}
 

RTC Interrupts

Macro definitions for RTC interrupt status bits.

These macros correspond to the bits in the RTC interrupt status register. They may be used with any of the am_hal_rtc_int_x() functions.

#define AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM   RTC_INTEN_ALM_Msk
 

Macro Definition Documentation

◆ AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_100TH

#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_100TH   0xFF

◆ AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_10TH

#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_10TH   0xF0

◆ AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_DEFAULT

#define AM_HAL_RTC_ALM100_DEFAULT   0x00

These macros are used inside the am_hal_rtc_alarm_interval_set function when 10ms and 100ms repeated alarm intervals are desired.

◆ AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM

#define AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM   RTC_INTEN_ALM_Msk

◆ RTC_CDC_WA_DELAY_US

#define RTC_CDC_WA_DELAY_US   10

A safe delay for RTC reg read.

RTC configuration structure.

◆ am_hal_rtc_time_t

typedef struct am_hal_rtc_time_struct am_hal_rtc_time_t

The basic time structure used by the HAL for RTC interaction.

All values are positive whole numbers. The HAL routines convert back and forth to BCD.

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_rtc_alarm_get()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_alarm_get ( am_hal_rtc_time_t * pTime,
am_hal_rtc_alarm_repeat_e * peRepeatInterval )

Get the Real Time Clock Alarm Parameters.

Parameters
*pTime- A pointer to the time structure to store the current alarm.
peRepeatInterval- pointer to the desired alarm repeat interval.

Retrieves the RTC's current alarm time and repeat interval settings.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_config()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_config ( const am_hal_rtc_config_t * psConfig)

Configures the RTC.

Parameters
psConfigis a pointer to a configuration structure for the RTC.

Configures the oscillator and 12/24hr settings for the RTC. See the am_hal_rtc_config_t structure for more information.

Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_interrupt_clear ( uint32_t ui32InterruptMask)

Clear selected RTC interrupts.

Parameters
ui32InterruptMask- desired interrupts

Clears the RTC interrupts.

ui32Interrupt should be an OR of the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_interrupt_enable()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_interrupt_enable ( uint32_t ui32InterruptMask)

Enable selected RTC interrupts.

Parameters
ui32InterruptMask- desired interrupts

Enables the RTC interrupts. ui32InterruptMask should be set to a logical OR of one or more of the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_interrupt_enable_get()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_interrupt_enable_get ( uint32_t * pui32InterruptMask)

Return the enabled RTC interrupts.

Parameters
pui32InterruptMaskis a pointer where the current RTC interrupt enable mask will be written.

Returns the enabled RTC interrupts. pui32InterruptMask will be set to a logical OR of one or more of the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_interrupt_set()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_interrupt_set ( uint32_t ui32InterruptMask)

Sets the selected RTC interrupts.

Parameters
ui32InterruptMask- desired interrupts

Sets the RTC interrupts causing them to immediately trigger.

ui32Interrupt should be an OR of the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_interrupt_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_rtc_interrupt_status_get ( bool bEnabledOnly,
uint32_t * pui32InterruptMask )

Returns the RTC interrupt status.

Parameters
bEnabledOnlyif true, return the status of enabled interrupts only.
pui32InterruptMaskpointer where the interrupt status will be written.

This function will write the current RTC interrupt status to pui32InterruptMask. The interrupt status value will be the logical OR of one or more of the following: 

AM_HAL_RTC_INT_ALM
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS or relevant HAL error code.

◆ am_hal_rtc_osc_select()

void am_hal_rtc_osc_select ( uint32_t ui32OSC)

Selects the clock source for the RTC.

Parameters
ui32OSCthe clock source for the RTC.

This function selects the clock source for the RTC.

Valid values for ui32OSC are: 

AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_LFRC
AM_HAL_RTC_OSC_XT
Note
After selection of the RTC oscillator, a 2 second delay occurs before the new setting is reflected in status. Therefore the CLKGEN.STATUS.OMODE bit will not reflect the new status until after the 2s wait period.
